text: Ariana Grande has penned a heartfelt letter to her fans urging bravery and compassion just days after the tragic attack in Manchester that left 22 people dead and scores more injured. In the letter, Grande painted a picture of her fans as a resilient network of diverse people with diametrically opposed values to those of the type of individual who would strap a bomb to their chests and attack an innocent crowd. Music, she wrote, is a great unifying force in the world, and terrorist attacks and hate shouldn't stop the joy that it brings to people. Grande's letter follows just days after a suicide bomber posted up outside of a concert of hers in Manchester.
